lines.text: Could be... someone was anticipating the <c=#0000FF>Stop Wizard</c> would cast <c=#0000FF>Flesh to Stone.</c>
Either Slick or the Go Wizard- they wanted the Stop Wizard dead, and set the fire so they'd have a status condition.
That way, when the spell hit, it'd rebound!
I don't think it was Slick, though.
Guy had a gun, if he wanted the Stop Wizard dead- and I doubt he'd know the ins and outs of that spell.
So that leaves the Go Wizard, then?
...Maybe. It looks like they were <c=#FF00FF>working together,</c> but maybe there was some tension?
It looks pretty unlikely right now. If we come across something to show a motive there, maybe, but...
For now, let's look for other explanations.
